str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To nod, make a sign, beckon. From kata and neuo; to nod down, i.e. to make signs to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sharer, partner, associate. From metecho; participant, i.e. a sharer; by implication, an associate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To come, go.
From sun and lambano; to clasp, i.e. Seize; specially, to conceive; by implication, to aid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To fill, fulfill, complete. A prolonged form of a primary pleo to 'fill' (imbue, influence, supply); specially, to fulfil.
Both (of two). Comparative of amphi; both.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To cause to sink; mid: I sink, submerge, drown. From buthos; to sink; by implication, to drown.
